page.title: 07HOUSING IN KIRKBY LONSDALE
page.content: Within Kirkby Lonsdale itself most of the buildings are of{local stone}with {slate and tiled}roofs.Most of the houses in the centre are small terraced ones,often with{Georgian {facades}concealing older properties. Over the last decade many of these buildings have been renovated to make very desirable residences.On the edge of town small{modern estates}have been built at Lunefield and Fairgarth.These are often bungalows.As the area is predominantly rural,traditional stone built{farmhouses},with stone barns and outbuildings are dotted throughout the valley and on the side of the fells. With the consolidation of farms,some of these have fallen into disuse and others have been renovated as{holiday {properties.
